alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Greene and Pitt. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in Farmville due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Farmville, Bell Arthur, Bruce, Lizzie, Fountain, Castoria, Bull Head VFD, Fort Run VFD, Shine, Walstonburg and Falkland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
